message.content: The registry entry "PowerdownAfterShutdown" with a value of 0 indicates that the system is set to reboot after shutdown rather than fully power off. This setting can be used by malware to ensure persistence by preventing a complete shutdown. In this case, the registry key associated with this setting is found under "Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon" in the registry hive "software." It is crucial to investigate further for any malicious activities or payloads that might be leveraging this setting for unauthorized access or data exfiltration.
